730818f-a.title: Bridges - Henry Hudson Bridge - [Inwood Hill Park.]
730818f-a.text:
Henry Hudson Bridge: A set of 2 views of the concrete base under
construction at the edge of Inwood Hill Park, Manhattan. Slightly north
of same is the Railroad Bridge that carries the New York Central tracks
across the Harlem River. In the right background is visible the New
Jersey Shore.
September 31, 1935.
View 2:-September 16, 1935.
P. L. Sperr.
(Not a dry mount item).
730818f-a.folder: Henry Hudson Bridge, New York, N.Y.

730818f-b.title: Bridges - Henry Hudson Bridge - [Inwood Hill Park.]

730818f-b.folder: Henry Hudson Bridge, New York, N.Y.

730819f-a.title: Bridges - Henry Hudson Memorial Bridge.
730819f-a.text:
Henry Hudson Memorial Bridge: A view southeastward of same while
under construction. Photographers vantage point is in the Spuyten Du
section of the Bronx. On the far side of the Harlem River is Inwood
Park, Manhattan.
1936.
W.P.A. Photo.
Federal Writers Project.
(Not a dry mount item)..
730819f-a.folder: Henry Hudson Bridge, New York, N.Y.

730820f-a.title: Bridges - Henry Hudson Memorial Bridge - [Inwood Hill Park.]
730820f-a.text:
Henry Hudson Memorial Bridge: A view southwestward of this new
structure that will carry an extension of Riverside Drive across to the
Borough of the Bronx. This new highway will also bear the name, Henry
Hudson. Photographers vantage point is in the Spuyten Duyvil section
of the Bronx and he shows Inwood Hill Park on the far side of the
Harlem River.
1936.
W.P.A. Photo.
Federal Writers Project.
(not a dry mount item).
730820f-a.folder: Henry Hudson Bridge, New York, N.Y.

730821f-a.title: Bridges - Henry Hudson Bridge - [Harlem River.]
730821f-a.text:
Henry Hudson Bricge over the Narlem river, seen from the Hudson
River, In the foreground is the New Sork Central Railroad Bridge.
P. L. Sperr  1937
NO REPPODTCTIONS  Views 1,2
730821f-a.folder: Henry Hudson Bridge, New York, N.Y.

730824f-c.title: Bridges - Henry Hudson Bridge - [View of the bridge over Harlem River, linking Spuyten Duyvil Hill, Bronx with Inwood Hill Park, Manhattan.]
730824f-c.text:
(1)
Henry Hudson Bridge, spanning the Harlem River, between
Tnwood Hill Park, Manhattan and Spuyten Duyvil Bill, the Bronx.
The view is west toward the palisades of New Wersey and shows,
also, the New York Central Railroad bridge (left).
Sugust 2, 1939
P. L. Sperr
(2)
The Henry Sudson Pridge and New York Central Railroad
bridge (openJ, seen from Spuyten Duyvil Hill, the Bronx. In
the background is the shore of New ersey.
July 15, 1939
P. L. Sperr
(3)
Viewing northeastward from the Hudson River across the
New York Central Railroad and Senry udson Bridge9,toward
Spuyten Duyvil.
August 2, 1939
P. L. Sperr
730824f-c.folder: Henry Hudson Bridge, New York, N.Y.

730823f-b.title: Bridges - Henry Hudson Bridge.
730823f-b.text:
(1)
Henry Hudson Bridge: A view east from Independence
Avenue, in the Spuyten Duyvil section of the Bronx.
May 25, 1937
P. L. Sperr
(2) and (3)
Two views,looking westward on the Harlem River, of the bridge,
Spuyten Duyvil Hill, the Bronx, and the New Jersey shore on the
west bank of the Hudson River. The apartment house is the Villa
Victoria, and below the hill is visible the Spuyten Duyvil station
of the SSew York Central Railroad.
August 21, 1939
P. L. Sperr
730823f-b.folder: Henry Hudson Bridge, New York, N.Y.
